meanings.definition: A person used by others for their own purposes.
meanings.sent1: The pawn was always willing to do whatever others asked of them.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a pawn in their game, being manipulated and controlled.
meanings.sent3: The pawn in the office always ended up doing everyone else's work.
meanings.sent4: Feeling like a pawn in the grand scheme of things, he decided to take control of his own destiny.
meanings.sent5: The pawn's role in the play was crucial, even though they were often overlooked.

meanings.definition: An object left as security for money borrowed.
meanings.sent1: He left his watch as a pawn for the cash he needed.
meanings.sent2: The pawnshop accepted the ring as collateral for the loan.
meanings.sent3: Leaving his phone as a pawn, he hoped to get the money he needed.
meanings.sent4: The pawn of the loan was a valuable painting, ensuring he would pay back.
meanings.sent5: The pawn he left was a family heirloom, but he needed the money urgently.

meanings.definition: To deposit as security, as for money borrowed.
meanings.sent1: She had to pawn her jewelry to get the money for the rent.
meanings.sent2: He decided to pawn his guitar to pay off his debts.
meanings.sent3: In a desperate move, he had to pawn his laptop for some quick cash.
meanings.sent4: She pawned her car to secure the loan for her business.
meanings.sent5: The man had to pawn his watch to cover the unexpected expenses.
